title: LIVE: Cook-along with Vélochef
content:
March 22, 2021

Rouleur and chef Henrik Orre cooking up a storm on Insta Live

Top chef Henrik Orre joins us on Instagram Live this Friday evening (March 26) for the latest cook-along with the Vélochef.

Henrik spent five seasons on the road producing nutritious and delicious meals for Team Sky, as well as chefing at several of Oslo's top restaurants, before becoming head chef at the Michelin 2-star Matbaren in Stockholm.

With his Vélochef Clubhouse in Oslo currently receiving its final touches ahead of a planned May opening, chef Henrik is working flat out but has made space in his hectic schedule to show us how to cook his famous rice cakes - a big favourite with pro riders that can fuel your rides too. 

Nutritious, delicious, and easy to make. Do join us.

Rouleur subscribers will receive a printable recipe card, but if you'd like to follow along, here is your shopping list and a list of things that you'll need. Don't worry if you're not a pro in the kitchen, it's easy to follow.

When: Friday March 26th - 19:00 (UK time)

Where: Rouleur Instagram

Recipe: Rice cakes

Equipment required: 

Rice cooker or pot on stove

1 3-litre plastic zip lock bag

1 spatula

Tin foil for wrapping 

Ingredients required: 

500g risotto rice

800g water

1tsp cinnamon

1tbs coconut oil

2tbs coconut sugar

200g Philadelphia cream cheese

Agave syrup (maple syrup or honey alternatively)

Steps:

  • Boil the rice, water, coconut oil, cinnamon and coconut sugar
  • Let it boil until all the water has been absorbed - it´s very important you got a dry rice before you add more condiments
  • Fold the cream cheese into the warm rice
  • Mix in the agave syrup and blend thoroughly
  • Pour into a 3 litre zip bag
  • Flatten the bag and leave in the fridge overnight
  • Cut into pieces, 5x5 cm
  • Wrap in tin foil

Enjoy!
author: Miles Baker-Clarke
